item.title: Project 3: Climate Change Belief Analysis (tweet sentiment)
item.description: This Project’s GitHub Repository For this project I was assigned to a team of 5 individuals. We then decided to allocate 2 Project Managers as co-leaders for this project. Myself and another individual took on this role. We made use of external tools (to ensure the success of this project) such as: Trello (project management) Streamlit (model deployment) Comet (version control) MS Powerpoint (project presentation) A basic project breakdown and the steps we followed can be found below:

item.title: Project 2: South African Language Identification (Classification Hackathon)
item.description: This Project’s GitHub Repository (Image credit) In this hackathon, I was tasked with creating a model that takes text (as input) which is in any of South Africa’s 11 official languages. This model must then identify which language the text is in. I started off with some basic EDA (Exploratory Data Analysis) to get an idea of the state of the data â€“ which I found to be quite clean.

item.title: Project 1: Spain Electricity Shortfall Challenge
item.description: This Project’s GitHub Repository In this project, my team (consisting of 5 individuals) was tasked to model the shortfall between the energy generated by means of fossil fuels and various renewable sources - for the country of Spain. The team decided that I take on the position of Project Manager. The load_shortfall_3h (3-Hour Daily Shortfall) was modelled as a function of various city-specific weather features such as pressure, wind speed, humidity, etc.
